timeline.raw_data: {"type": "email", "timestamp": "2025-08-23T09:35:26", "sender_email": "rishabh.m@amberstudent.com", "recipient_email": "lr.contrevida@gmail.com", "subject": "Quick Follow-Up: Details Needed for Your Piccadilly Court Booking \ud83c\udfe1", "message": "Hi Layjha Reyn Contrevida,\\n\\nHope you're doing well!\\n\\nThank you for showing interest in Piccadilly Court, London (Classic Ensuite \u2013 51 weeks). To move forward with your booking and secure the room, we just need a few more details from your side.\\n\\nCould you please share the following at your earliest convenience?\\n\\n-\\nEmergency contact name\\n\\n-\\nEmergency contact number\\n\\n-\\nRelationship to you\\n\\nThese are mandatory to complete your application and issue the agreement.\\n\\nLet me know if you have any questions \u2014 happy to assist!\\n\\nLooking forward to getting this sorted for you quickly \ud83d\ude0a\\n\\nBest regards,\\nRishabh\\nAmber | Official Accommodation Partner for UCL\\n\\n--\\n\\n[amberstudent.com]\\n\\nRishabh M\\n\\nSenior Operation Associate\\n\\nPhone: [+447460047271]()\\n\\nWhatsapp: [+447460047271]()\\n\\nEmail: [rishabh.m@amberstudent.com]()\\n\\nWebsite: [amberstudent.com]()", "snippet": "Hi Layjha Reyn Contrevida, Hope you're doing well! Thank you for showing interest in Piccadilly Court, London (Classic Ensuite \u2013 51 weeks). To move forward with your booking and secure the room, we", "direction": "outbound", "sender_type": "agent", "agent_email": "rishabh.m@amberstudent.com", "student_email": "lr.contrevida@gmail.com"}

transcripts.transcript_text:
Speaker B: Hello?
Speaker A: Yeah, hello, am I speaking with Lila here?
Speaker B: Yes, this is her, yeah.
Speaker A: Actually this address of from Ambit student and we are the official accommodation partner for UCL London. I just see that you have filled a booking form for Picardley Court, London, correct?
Speaker B: Pardon?
Speaker A: I can see that you have selected a property by the name of Picardley Court, London, correct? Yes, but here some details are missing. Like you haven't mentioned the emergency contact or the guarantor detail. So can you please do one thing here? I'll be connecting with you on the WhatsApp. Can you please share me the detail of the emergency contact and the current so that I can proceed you with your application?
Speaker B: I haven't continued the application because I'm still looking at other accommodation right now. But once I finish I. If I want to, I will continue with the application. I'm sorry if that causes any confusion.
Speaker A: No, no, that's not an issue. May know like what kind of requirements that you have so that I can share you some options.
Speaker B: I would just like to have a viewing of the place before I make my final decision.
Speaker A: Okay. So for you wish to view the Picardley code at the moment or there any other property available?
Speaker B: Paron.
Speaker A: When will you be available for the weaving?
Speaker B: I am available Monday 25th.
Speaker A: Monday 21st, correct? Yeah, I'll do one thing here. I'll check if the property. If we can arrange a viewing from the property. Although there. There might be a chance that I'll be able to do that. And once the weaving is arranged, I will let you know. Okay.
Speaker B: Okay, perfect.
Speaker A: Yes, that's fine.
Speaker B: Thank you. Yes, that's good. Thank you. Have a good day.
Speaker A: Thank you, bye.

Speaker B: Hello?
Speaker A: Yeah, hello. Are you taking it later? Actually, this call is regarding your student accommodation. That's the reason I called you up.
Speaker B: Oh, which location?
Speaker A: It's from the UCL you were interested in the Carli code, if I'm not wrong.
Speaker B: Oh, Garden hall, yes. Ucl, yes.
Speaker A: So have you finalized the property yet?
Speaker B: Pardon?
Speaker A: Have you finalized the student accommodation for you?
Speaker B: Finalized accommodation? No, I haven't. I'm still looking.
Speaker A: Okay, so I. I suppose that you wish to have a weaving, correct?
Speaker B: Yeah.
Speaker A: So should I. Should I schedule it for the Picardi code? The one which you have filled the booking?
Speaker B: Sorry, I already went. I went there at three. I got there early and I was like, I'm here for a viewing and Hugo just let me see the place. So, yeah.
Speaker A: Do you wish to proceed ahead with that property or like you wish to change?
Speaker B: I would like a couple more days to finalize my decision. But it is a good accommodation.
Speaker A: It really is. It really is. So I'll do one thing here. I'll basically give you a call after two days. So I'm hoping by that time you'll be able to confirm me, like, if you wish to proceed ahead with the court.
Speaker B: Yes, that's. Yes, that's perfect. Thank you.
Speaker A: Or should I do one thing here for you? Should I block a room for Picardi code at the moment? If you wish to go ahead, all you need to do is you need to accept the offer. By doing that, we can block the room before it gets sold out. So should I proceed ahead? No, not at the moment.
Speaker B: No, not at the moment. Please do not proceed ahead.
Speaker A: Okay, don't worry. We should take your time. I'll give you a call after two weeks. Okay?
Speaker B: Yes, that's perfect. Thank you. Thank you. Have a lovely day.

Speaker B: Hello.
Speaker A: Yeah hello, I'm speaking at LALA here. Yes this is Rishabh actually from AMDA students. We have actually scheduled. We have actually this edition from AMBER students and we have scheduled a viewing for you so just wanted to confirm like if you have decided with the accommodation options now.
Speaker B: Can you repeat that please?
Speaker A: So actually we have scheduled the viewing correct for you as UNITE student and you went to view the property so just wanted to confirm if you have decided with the options now.
Speaker B: Oh no, I found another accommodation.
Speaker A: And which property that you have found?
Speaker B: Stapleton House.
Speaker A: Nice student. Stapleton House.
Speaker B: Yeah. UNITE students. Stapleton House.
Speaker A: So have you already booked the accommodation or like you will be booking it in some time?
Speaker B: I've already booked it.
Speaker A: You already booked it?
Speaker B: Yes.
Speaker A: Okay. That's not an issue. Thank you so much.
Speaker B: Okay. Is that all?
Speaker A: Yeah.
Speaker B: Okay. Thank you.
